alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:39PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Uintah County through 515 PM MDT... At 438 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whiterocks, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Uintah County, including the following locations... Maeser. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 356 and 361. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
